text:
đź‡¸đź‡® Slovenia: Mojca Mavec Announced as Commentator For Eurovision 2021
Mojca Mavec will commentate for RTVSLO at the 65th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest next week.
It has been announced that Mojca Mavec will be this year’s commentator for RTVSLO viewers across Slovenia this year. Mojca Mavec has previous experience as a commentator at the contest having previously commentated for RTVSlo between 2005 andÂ 2007.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by EMA – Eurovision Slovenia (@emaevrovizija)
This year Ana Soklic Is representing Slovenia at the Eurovision Song contest and will sing “Amen” in the first Semi-final on Tuesday, 18 May.
Who is Ana Soklic?
Ana SokliÄŤ was born in 1984 in Bohinj in northwestern Slovenia. From a young age, Anna SokliÄŤ developed and refined her musical skills at the local opera and jazz academy, before she started to write her own music. She was the lead singer of Diona Dim, with whom she previously tried to represent Slovenia in 2004 with the song â€śIf youâ€ť and in 2007 with the song â€śOÄŤeâ€ť (Father). In 2012, she participated the first and so far only series of X Factor Slovenia, where she finished fifth overall. In 2019, she participated in theÂ Slovenka popevkaÂ festival with the song â€śTemni svetâ€ť (Dark world) and finished 10th overall.
Image Source: EBU / Andres Putting
Slovenia in the Eurovision Song Contest Slovenia was one of three countries to join the Eurovision Song Contest in 1993. The country qualified through a specially organised selection round called â€śKvalifikacija za Millstreetâ€ť which was hosted in Slovenia, seven countries competed for three spots in Eurovision 1993. The country has participated in 22 editions of the Eurovision Song Contest. Their best result came in 1995 when Darja Ĺ vajger finished 7th scoring a total of 84 points, she is closely followed by NuĹˇa Derenda who finished 7th in the 2001 contest with 70 points.
